title: It uses worker threads to execute the tasks parallelly.

inline_content.Text: It uses worker threads to execute the tasks parallelly.

title: public static final Executor THREAD_POOL_EXECUTOR = new ThreadPoolExecutor(CORE_POOL_SIZE, MAXIMUM_POOL_SIZE, KEEP_ALIVE, TimeUnit.SECONDS, sPoolWorkQueue, sThreadFactory);

title: It executes the task serially, i.e. one by one.

title: Therefore, if you try to do multiple background task with the default Executor (
SerialExecutor
c
), these task will be queue and executed serially.

), these task will be queue and executed serially.

c
, then they will be executed parallelly.

title: It is executing the task serially hence every task is started after the current task completed execution. Hence when Task 1’s execution completes, only Task 2 starts running in background. Vice versa.

inline_content.Text: It is executing the task serially hence every task is started after the current task completed execution. Hence when Task 1’s execution completes, only Task 2 starts running in background. Vice versa.
